reg:regulation.reg:title: Administrative Penalties Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 264/2014, December 22, 2014]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Utilities Commission Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 42, 43, 44 or 73 of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $500 000, if the person is a corporation, and
$100 000, if the person is a director, officer or agent of a corporation that contravenes the section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes an order under section 47 of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $200 000, if the person is a corporation, and
$100 000, if the person is a director, officer or agent of a corporation that contravenes the section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 71 or 71.1 of the Act is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $100 000.
A person who contravenes a reliability standard adopted by the commission is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $1 000 000, if the person is a corporation, and
$100 000, if the person is a director, officer or agent of a corporation that contravenes the reliability standard.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes any section of the Act other than those referred to in subsections (1) to (4) of this section is liable to an administrative penalty not exceeding $25 000.
Section 47 of the Act and all reliability standards adopted by the commission are prescribed for the purposes of section 109.2 (2) of the Act.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Utilities Commission Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 473, sections 109.2 and 125]
